item.title: Obituaries for January 4
item.description: Marciana Ogoc Estencion, 77, of Kailua-Kona died, Dec. 4 at Kona Community Hospital. Born in Kealakekua, she was a stock clerk for the former KMart and delivered newspapers for West Hawaii Today. Visitation 8:30-10 a.m. Friday, Jan. 23, at St. John’s Catholic Church in Kealakekua. Mass at 10 a.m. Burial to follow at Kona Memorial Park in Holualoa. Casual attire. Survived by son, James Mark (Roslyn) Thomas of Kona; stepchildren, Yolanda (Rick) Bautista of Honolulu, Alfred Estencion of Kona, Darren Estencion of Maui and Eldaine Barawis of Kailua-Kona; godchildren, Casey Keohuloa, Pikake Keohuloa and Trina Kauhaihao; three grandchildren; nieces, nephews, and cousins. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.
item.source:markdown: Marciana Ogoc Estencion, 77, of Kailua-Kona died, Dec. 4 at Kona Community Hospital. Born in Kealakekua, she was a stock clerk for the former KMart and delivered newspapers for West Hawaii Today. Visitation 8:30-10 a.m. Friday, Jan. 23, at St. John’s Catholic Church in Kealakekua. Mass at 10 a.m. Burial to follow at Kona Memorial Park in Holualoa. Casual attire. Survived by son, James Mark (Roslyn) Thomas of Kona; stepchildren, Yolanda (Rick) Bautista of Honolulu, Alfred Estencion of Kona, Darren Estencion of Maui and Eldaine Barawis of Kailua-Kona; godchildren, Casey Keohuloa, Pikake Keohuloa and Trina Kauhaihao; three grandchildren; nieces, nephews, and cousins. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

item.title: Shock and skepticism in world’s capitals after US seizes Maduro
item.description: BERLIN — Despite the long military buildup around Venezuela, the U.S. raid on Caracas, the capital, to capture President Nicolás Maduro and his wife produced initial reactions of shock, outrage and skepticism from international leaders, many of them troubled by an exercise of U.S. gunboat diplomacy.
item.source:markdown: BERLIN — Despite the long military buildup around Venezuela, the U.S. raid on Caracas, the capital, to capture President Nicolás Maduro and his wife produced initial reactions of shock, outrage and skepticism from international leaders, many of them troubled by an exercise of U.S. gunboat diplomacy.

item.title: Venezuelan official says at least 40 people were killed in US attack
item.description: (NYT) — At least 40 people were killed in the U.S. attack on Venezuela early Saturday, including military personnel and civilians, according to a senior Venezuelan official who spoke on the condition of anonymity to describe preliminary reports.
item.source:markdown: (NYT) — At least 40 people were killed in the U.S. attack on Venezuela early Saturday, including military personnel and civilians, according to a senior Venezuelan official who spoke on the condition of anonymity to describe preliminary reports.

item.title: Trump administration declines to back Venezuela’s opposition leader
item.description: President Donald Trump said Saturday that it would be “very tough” for Venezuela’s leading opposition figure, María Corina Machado, to take control of her country, claiming in his televised speech that she was a “very nice woman” but “doesn’t have the support” in Venezuela to lead.

item.title: Steves: Gibraltar is a bite of Britain in Spain
item.description: When in southern Spain, I can’t resist popping into the British colony of Gibraltar. Gibraltar is hardly signposted in Spain, as if Spain wishes the British colony didn’t exist. (Drivers follow highway signs to La Línea, the last Spanish town before the border.) But when you see that famous “Rock of Prudential” standing boldly above the sea, you know it’s here to stay.
item.source:markdown: When in southern Spain, I can’t resist popping into the British colony of Gibraltar. Gibraltar is hardly signposted in Spain, as if Spain wishes the British colony didn’t exist. (Drivers follow highway signs to La Línea, the last Spanish town before the border.) But when you see that famous “Rock of Prudential” standing boldly above the sea, you know it’s here to stay.

item.title: Madang reconnected to Ramu Grid after heroic effort by PNG Power Crews
item.description:
Residents of Madang are finally back on the grid following a grueling restoration effort by PNG Power Limited (PPL) teams who battled extreme weather conditions to repair the L605 transmission line.

The coastal town had been split from the main Ramu grid after heavy rains and severe flooding at the Assas bypass triggered a major system fault.

To access this post, you must purchase Web or Web & eBook.

The post Madang reconnected to Ramu Grid after heroic effort by PNG Power Crews appeared first on Post Courier.
item.source:markdown:

Residents of Madang are finally back on the grid following a grueling restoration effort by PNG Power Limited (PPL) teams who battled extreme weather conditions to repair the L605 transmission line.
The coastal town had been split from the main Ramu grid after heavy rains and severe flooding at the Assas bypass triggered a major system fault.

item.title: Major power failure plunges Highlands hubs into darkness
item.description:
A major fault on the main 66kV transmission line has left thousands of residents and businesses across the Highlands region without power, as PNG Power Limited (PPL) scrambles to stabilize the Ramu Grid.

The disruption occurred after Transmission Line 506, the primary link carrying electricity from Ramu through Goroka to the Highlands, tripped off. The outage has affected several provincial hubs, including: Kainantu, Goroka, Kundiawa, Kudjip, Mt. Hagen

To access this post, you must purchase Web or Web & eBook.

The post Major power failure plunges Highlands hubs into darkness appeared first on Post Courier.

item.title: Central Provincial Government moves to protect rural producers from market harassment
item.description:
The Central Provincial Government (CPG), led by Deputy Governor and Chairman for Law & Order, Desmond Baira, is initiating high-level meetings to address the systemic harassment of rural producers supplying the National Capital District (NCD).

Farmers, fishermen, and betelnut growers from Central Province report growing intimidation and extortion when transporting goods to major NCD hubs, including Gordons, Boroko, and Koki. A primary concern is the predatory behaviour of "middlemen" who demand unauthorised "carrying fees."

To access this post, you must purchase Web or Web & eBook.

The post Central Provincial Government moves to protect rural producers from market harassment appeared first on Post Courier.
item.source:markdown:
![](https://www.postcourier.com.pg/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Central-Provincial-Government-moves-to-protect-rural-producers-from-market-harassment.png?w=800)
The Central Provincial Government (CPG), led by Deputy Governor and Chairman for Law & Order, Desmond Baira, is initiating high-level meetings to address the systemic harassment of rural producers supplying the National Capital District (NCD).
Farmers, fishermen, and betelnut growers from Central Province report growing intimidation and extortion when transporting goods to major NCD hubs, including Gordons, Boroko, and Koki. A primary concern is the predatory behaviour of "middlemen" who demand unauthorised "carrying fees."

And he declared his devotion to the cause and his willingness to die for it.

item.title: A study is retracted, renewing concerns about the weedkiller Roundup
item.description: In 2000, a landmark study claimed to set the record straight on glyphosate, a contentious weedkiller used on hundreds of millions of acres of farmland. The paper found that the chemical, the active ingredient in Roundup, wasn’t a human health risk despite evidence of a cancer link.

item.title: Mayor’s Cup revives touch rugby in West New Britain
item.description:
By ELIZABETH PINJWAI MAKIS

The revival of Touch Rugby in West New Britain Province (WNBP) has reached a turning point this week with the hosting of the inaugural Mayor’s Cup touch tournament. The tournament, which launched on Christmas Day, is being hailed as a critical "restart" for a sport that has remained largely dormant in the province for a decade.

item.title: Pacific Towing successfully refloats Coral Adventurer
item.description:
Pacific Towing (PacTow) is pleased to announce the successful refloating of the previously grounded Coral Expeditions cruise vessel, CORAL ADVENTURER (IMO 9838644).

The refloating took place on the afternoon of December 30, 2025, near Dregerhafen, approximately 65 miles north-east of Lae, Papua New Guinea.

item.title: Access Road to Water PNG washed out by heavy rain in Popondetta
item.description:
Heavy rainfall on New Year’s Eve has left the access road to the Water PNG facility in Popondetta severely damaged, creating significant hazards for motorists and pedestrians.

The damage was reportedly exacerbated by a blocked stormwater drain. According to local resident Mathew Malpaim, a discarded tyre was dumped into the drainage system, obstructing the natural flow of water.

item.title: Bradley Wak calls for unity in Dei District with major peace offering
item.description:
Two tribes in the Dei District of Western Highlands Province have participated in a major reconciliation ceremony to restore solidarity and peace ahead of the 2026 calendar year.

The event, hosted by intending candidate for the Dei Open by-election, Baffinu Bradley Wak, marked a formal reunion between the Prandak and Kinsibi Rangikrambo tribes. The ceremony was organized to encourage both groups to set aside past differences and live as neighbors in harmony.

To access this post, you must purchase Web or Web & eBook.

The post Bradley Wak calls for unity in Dei District with major peace offering appeared first on Post Courier.
item.source:markdown:
![](https://www.postcourier.com.pg/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Intending-candidate-for-Dei-Open-by-election-Baffinu-Bradley-Wak-speaking-during-the-reconciliation-ceremony-at-his-Waigini-village-on-Thursday.png?w=800)
Two tribes in the Dei District of Western Highlands Province have participated in a major reconciliation ceremony to restore solidarity and peace ahead of the 2026 calendar year.
The event, hosted by intending candidate for the Dei Open by-election, Baffinu Bradley Wak, marked a formal reunion between the Prandak and Kinsibi Rangikrambo tribes. The ceremony was organized to encourage both groups to set aside past differences and live as neighbors in harmony.
To access this post, you must purchase [Web](https://www.postcourier.com.pg/product/web/) or [Web & eBook](https://www.postcourier.com.pg/product/web-ebook/).
The post [Bradley Wak calls for unity in Dei District with major peace offering](https://www.postcourier.com.pg/bradley-wak-calls-for-unity-in-dei-district-with-major-peace-offering/) appeared first on [Post Courier](https://www.postcourier.com.pg).

item.title: OTML responds to MP James Donald as legal battle over Mine future intensifies
item.description:
Ok Tedi Mining Limited (OTML) has broken its silence regarding the environmental and legal future of the mine, following a scathing public address by North Fly MP James Donald.

In a formal statement released yesterday, the mining giant acknowledged the growing public debate but maintained a firm stance that the matter is now a judicial concern.

item.title: ICCC confirms fuel price to increase commencing on January 8
item.description:
The Independent Consumer and Competition Commission (ICCC) has announced the increase in wholesale, retail, and drum-filling prices for petrol, diesel, and kerosene to be effective starting January 8, 2026.

The acting chief executive officer, Brian Ivosa, said the annual adjustments were in accordance with the determinations of the 2024 Petroleum Industry pricing review, applying in the five-year (2024-2029) regulatory period.

To access this post, you must purchase Web or Web & eBook.

The post ICCC confirms fuel price to increase commencing on January 8 appeared first on Post Courier.

item.title: [Ask the Tax Whiz] A practical guide to year-end tax compliance in the Philippines
item.description: It is essential that payroll records, withholding tax returns, and alphalists are fully reconciled. Any mismatch between amounts reported and taxes actually remitted during the year may result in penalties or assessments.
item.source:markdown: It is essential that payroll records, withholding tax returns, and alphalists are fully reconciled. Any mismatch between amounts reported and taxes actually remitted during the year may result in penalties or assessments.

item.title: Ela Murray International School brings holiday cheer to children at Port Moresby General Hospital
item.description:
The Ela Murray International School has extended the spirit of giving this festive season, delivering joy and comfort to young patients at Port Moresby General Hospital (PMGH).

As part of its Gift-a-Friend, Christmas and New Year Charity Drive, the school donated 250 gift bags filled with essential items and festive treats. The gifts, lovingly prepared by students and parents, were distributed across all five paediatric wards, ensuring children spending the holidays in hospital could share in the celebrations with their families.

To access this post, you must purchase Web or Web & eBook.

The post Ela Murray International School brings holiday cheer to children at Port Moresby General Hospital appeared first on Post Courier.
